planets.name: Mercury
planets.description: Mercury is the smallest planet in our solar system and closest to the Sun. It has a heavily cratered surface and extreme temperature variations.
interesting_facts: One day on Mercury lasts 176 Earth days
Mercury has no atmosphere to retain heat
It's the fastest planet, orbiting the Sun in just 88 days

planets.name: Venus
planets.description: Venus is the hottest planet in our solar system with a thick, toxic atmosphere. It rotates backwards compared to most planets.
interesting_facts: Venus rotates backwards (retrograde rotation)
A day on Venus is longer than its year
Surface pressure is 92 times that of Earth

planets.name: Earth
planets.description: Earth is our home planet, the only known planet with life. It has liquid water, a protective atmosphere, and a perfect distance from the Sun.
interesting_facts: 71% of Earth's surface is covered by water
Earth is the only planet not named after a god
The planet's core is as hot as the Sun's surface

planets.name: Mars
planets.description: Mars, the Red Planet, is a cold desert world with a thin atmosphere. It has the largest volcano and canyon in the solar system.
interesting_facts: Mars has the largest volcano in the solar system (Olympus Mons)
A day on Mars is 24.6 hours, very similar to Earth
Mars has two small moons: Phobos and Deimos

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.description: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system. It has a Great Red Spot storm that has raged for hundreds of years.
interesting_facts: Jupiter is more than twice as massive as all other planets combined
The Great Red Spot is a storm larger than Earth
Jupiter has 95 known moons, including the four large Galilean moons

planets.name: Saturn
planets.description: Saturn is famous for its spectacular ring system. It's the least dense planet and would float in water if there was a bathtub big enough!
interesting_facts: Saturn's rings are made of billions of ice and rock particles
Saturn is the least dense planet - it would float in water
Saturn has 146 known moons, more than any other planet

planets.name: Uranus
planets.description: Uranus is an ice giant that rotates on its side. It has a blue-green color due to methane in its atmosphere.
interesting_facts: Uranus rotates on its side at a 98-degree angle
It's the coldest planet with temperatures of -224Â°C
Uranus has 13 known rings and 27 moons

planets.name: Neptune
planets.description: Neptune is the windiest planet with supersonic winds. It's the farthest planet from the Sun and has a deep blue color.
interesting_facts: Neptune has the strongest winds in the solar system (2,100 km/h)
It takes 165 Earth years to orbit the Sun once
Neptune was discovered through mathematical predictions

planets.name: Pluto
planets.description: Pluto is a dwarf planet in the Kuiper Belt. It has a heart-shaped glacier and a thin atmosphere that freezes and falls to the surface.
interesting_facts: Pluto was reclassified as a dwarf planet in 2006
It has a heart-shaped region called Tombaugh Regio
Pluto's largest moon Charon is half its size

sun.name: Sun
sun.description: The Sun is the star at the center of our solar system. It contains 99.86% of the mass in the solar system.
interesting_facts: The Sun is 109 times wider than Earth
It takes 8 minutes for sunlight to reach Earth
The Sun will become a red giant in about 5 billion years
